title: Mass of LiOH needed to absorb CO2 from astronaut

content.question: What mass of <math alttext="L i O H, solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>LiOH</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> (molar mass <math alttext="24 grams per mole " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>24</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>g</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>) is needed to react with all of the <math alttext="C O 2, gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> produced by an astronaut in one day?

choices.label: <math alttext="40. decimal point grams" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>40.</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>g</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
